title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create a simple age checker:
1. Create a variable 'age' and set it to any number
2. Write an if statement that displays 'You can vote!' if age is 18 or greater
3. Test it with different ages (try 17, then try 18)
instructions:
Create a simple age checker:
1. Create a variable 'age' and set it to any number
2. Write an if statement that displays 'You can vote!' if age is 18 or greater
3. Test it with different ages (try 17, then try 18)

hints.text: Use the >= operator (greater than or equal to). Format: if (age >= 18) { console.log('You can vote!'); }

commonMistakes.consequence: if age >= 18 causes a syntax error.
commonMistakes.correction: Always wrap conditions in parentheses: if (age >= 18)

commonMistakes.consequence: if (age = 18) assigns 18 to age instead of comparing.
Only the next line belongs to the if statement, not subsequent lines.
commonMistakes.correction: Always use { } to define the code block.
